page.title: 04SURVEY OF AREA CONT..
page.content: ACTIVITY. FODDER CEREALS,GRASSES AND ROOTS ARE GROWN, PARTICULARY EASTWARDS WHILE OILSEED RAPE HAS BEEN INTRODUCED AS A NEW CROP. TRADITIONAL, FIELD BOUNDARIES ARE STILL WIDESPREAD BUT OLD STRUCTURES ARE OFTEN REPLACED BY DUTCH BARNS. 6. WOODLAND EXISTS ONLY AS THIN RIBBONS IN WET BOTTOMS. HEDGEROW TREES ARE SPARSE AND DISEASE HAS WIPED OUT MOST ELMS RECENTLY. 7. FARMS EMPLOY 3 OR 4 AT THE MOST, ALTHOUGH E.C.C. IS A MAJOR EMPLOYER, MECHANISATION HAS REDUCED RECRUITMENT. SMALL BUSINESSES AND SERVICES ARE THE MAIN EMPLOYMENT SOURCES IN TRURO OR ST AUSTELL. 8. TOURISM MAY OFFER SEASONAL DOMESTIC AND SHOP WORK LOCALLY WHILE MANY FARMS BENEFIT FROM B.B.TOURISM HAS BECOME A GROWTH INDUSTRY PRIMARILY DUE TO INCREASED CAR OWNERSHIP.
